column8: http://www.freemalaysiatoday.com/category/...ghts-says-hadi/PAS not the type to pick fights, says HadiFaiz Zainudin | May 1, 2017PAS president says every fallout the Islamist party has had with its former allies was triggered by others.hadi-pas-2ALOR SETAR: PAS says it is not a party which likes to pick fights with its political allies.This remark was made in light of the likelihood that the Islamist party will sever ties with yet another political ally, PKR.At a press conference at the end of the party’s 63rd muktamar today, PAS president Abdul Hadi Awang said PAS had always abided by the foundations of cooperation by respecting its allies’ core values.He said past “breakups” were always triggered by its former allies and not through any fault of PAS.“Look at our history of political cooperation with Umno. They were the ones who kicked us out. We didn’t leave.“Semangat 46 left our pact in 2000. It was DAP which left Barisan Alternatif.”In Pakatan Rakyat, Hadi said it was DAP which proclaimed the death of the pact without following any “rules”.“We didn’t leave Pakatan Rakyat.”PAS and DAP’s first “relationship” ended in 2000 when they were in Barisan Alternatif, and the reunion after the 2008 general election in Pakatan Rakyat ended in 2015.When asked about the possibility of three-cornered fights in the next general election, Hadi said PAS was not afraid of such contests.“We’ve faced all scenarios in politics because we’ve been in politics a long time.“We’ve been alone, we’ve been left with one seat and we’ve also had no seats; straight fights, three-cornered fights, we have had a lot of experience.”What was important, Hadi said, was that PAS members and divisions stayed loyal to the party leadership.Yesterday, the PAS muktamar passed a motion to cut ties with PKR, subject to a decision by the PAS Syura Council, the party’s highest decision-making body.This year’s muktamar was the second party assembly since the 2015 party elections which saw the defeat of several veteran leaders who were contesting for top posts.These leaders later set up Amanah, which is now part of Pakatan Harapan together with PKR, DAP and Parti Pribumi Bersatu Malaysia.
